186027562.review:
Dark Souls III è un gran bel gioco, faccio una premessa che non ho mai fatto i primi due della saga, ma ho comunque giocato a Sekiro ed Elden Ring e anche altri souls-like non di From. Partiamo col dire che l'ambientazione è molto bella e interessante da esplorare, la cosa che però ho apprezzato un sacco sono state le boss fight, molto pulite per le hit-box, anche se, al solito la telecamera è sempre mal fatta, ma gestibile e le compenetrazioni sono all'ordine del giorno, ma il vero capolavoro sono le musiche, quante volte ho ascoltato negli anni la ost di Soul of Cinder, quando sono arrivato al boss finale e la musica è partita è stata emozione fin da subito. Non reputo però, Dark Souls III superiore a Sekiro ed Elden Ring, ma ciò nonostante è molto bello, impegnativo, ma non impossibile, se vi buildate bene riuscirete a sconfiggere senza troppe difficoltà i boss che ci sono nel mondo di gioco.

Voto 8.7

185940772.review:
作为完整体验过只狼和老头环的玩家，是非常期待魂3的
在完整通过本体和环印城之后，我发现曾经的魂之所以没有面向大众，之所以没能像老头环一样成为家喻户晓的游戏，原因显而易见，存在着一些致命缺点  
比如，坐火点离boss房太远，路途中还要面对堆怪的折磨；跑图难度非常大，简直就是为了去折磨玩家才设计的游戏，一点都看不懂为什么路上的堆怪要这么严重，而且小怪的吼叫非常掉san值，仿佛自身置于地狱一般，每次跑图我都要在电脑旁边摆上另一台设备观看跑图的攻略，不然真的一点体验都没有，这一点的存在让我不想再去打开黑暗之魂系列的作品；刷誓约类型的物品，这个单纯是为了水游戏时长，没有意义，最后的奖励虽然比较诱人，但是不值得刷这么多物品所付出的时间和精力；
这些只是主要的毛病，而且这些的存在没有好处，老头环对这些地方的改进是最正确的选择，不然也不会成为如此优秀的作品，庞大数量的赐福点和玛莉卡契石就是证明。
不过以前的魂确实有他出色的地方，这是魂游的魅力所在，史诗感很强的背景故事，令人叹为观止的建筑，设计很出色的地图，交互感很舒服的boss战等等。
总而言之，这部游戏在我心里较难评价，算是中立的态度，不过我认为魂3没有辜负黑暗之魂这个系列，整部游戏给我带来的史诗感甚至比老头环还要强烈.......

185939724.review:
[h3] Почему все играют в эти ваши соулсы? [/h3]
Лично я пришёл в эту игру ради дарк фэнтези сеттинга и добротного челленджа. И то и другое я получил. Если вам нравится жанр и эстетика тёмного фэнтези, то добро пожаловать, здесь вы увидите: скрюченных смеющихся бабок, гниющих драконов, злых рыцорей, сросшуюся многоножку, злых ведьм, огромные готические замки (зимний и летний вариант), деревню крестьян которые любят полакомится навозными пирогами, и много чего ещё.
А что касается челленджа, то я бы описал это так: это игра средне-высокой сложности, где вы можете повысить себе сложность сами, путем искусственных усложнений. Под искусственными усложнениями я понимаю: не вызывать фантомов (других игроков) на помощь, не играть лёгкими билдами (через магию) и т.п. Лично я проходил эту игру через билд танка: много хп, большая пушка, но нет щита, от каждого чиха нужно уворачиваться. Именно такой стиль игры мне принёс максимум удовольствия. Магией и фантомами не пользовался. Утраты душ от смертей особо не ощущаются, так как ничто не мешает сразу их потратить на прокачку уровня, а не копить непонятно зачем (кроме ситуации с тёмной меткой, тут мои соболезнования). Большинство врагов можно просто пробежать, т.е. не обязательно заново чистить половину локации, если откинулся от босса и бежишь к нему заново.
Одна из важнейших особенностей таких игр – боссы. В целом, большинство из боссов проходятся даже без заучивания их мувсета и таймингов, но так или иначе для каждого из них подбирается тактика и именно поиск и использование слабых место боссов здесь вознаграждается. Бои с ними достаточно приятные из-за своей честности и возможности «затащить на скилле», ведь здесь боссы ещё не заболели синдромом задержки атаки, как в том же Елден Ринг. Мой любимы босс в игре – Фриде.
Вообще эта игра поощряет хладнокровие. Важно помнить, что это не гта или ведьмак какой-нибудь, где можно под пиво наслаждаться сюжетом и незатейливым геймплеем. Здесь вам нужно играть осторожно, ведь любое поспешное необдуманное действие и вас спокойно загрызут какие-нибудь собаки несмотря на то, что у вас уже 100-ый уровень и вы убиваете их с одного удара.
[h3] А минусы есть? [/h3]
Основной минус, или скорее особенность игры в том, что эта игра иногда душнит. Т.е. в ней есть такие моменты, которые могут оттолкнуть игрока: местами душные локации (например, болота, где мало того, что вы замедленны и отравлены, так ещё на вас набрасываются и трахают какие-то бесы), или отсутствие объяснений (например, город Иритилл огражден барьером, как туда попасть мы тебе не скажем), местами долгие пути до боссов. Ну тут для кого минус, а для кого испытание.
Также мне не совсем нравится прокачка в этой игре. А именно тот факт, что сильнее тебя делает не прокачка характеристик и экипировка, а то насколько у тебя заточена твоя пушка и сколько зарядов (и их силы) эстуса у тебя есть. Тут я столкнулся с такой проблемой, что до того, как я прокачал пушку, мне было интересно исследовать каждую помойку. Но, когда я заточил свою дубину на 10, каждый раз, когда я находил какой-то предмет я про себя говорил: «блин, опять не улучшение эстуса». Также я вкладывался в тяжелую броню, даже разобрался как тут работает баланс снаряжения. Но каким было моё удивления, когда я надел более лёгкий сет и получал столько же урона сколько и при тяжелом, да и баланс помогал только против слабых противников.
Ты видишь сюжет? Нет? А он есть! Да, тут сюжет подается через описания предметов. Это вам не трёхактная структура или флешбеки/флешфорварды. Читайте, разбирайтесь. Не могу назвать это сильной стороной игры, хотя кому-нибудь и зайдет.
[h3] Итог [/h3]
Несмотря на наличие некоторых минусов, я рекомендую эту игру всем, кто устал от press x to win. В некоторых местах придется затерпеть, это может быть непривычно, игроков сейчас разбаловали. Но когда вы преодолеете эти препятствия благодаря холодному расчету и упорству, вас будет за уши не оторвать, и вы будете просить ещё!

185892686.review: I got this game to see why people use 'dark souls' as a synonym for a difficult game. Sure, it's difficult, but it's also just bad and boring. The fighting mechanics is total garbage compared to Bannerlord f.x., which is also a medieval style game (dark souls has swords and crossbows, so I say 'medieval'). It takes the character an exorbitant amount of time to render a move, the animation for defending with a shield is total trash, everything is about dodging. Dodging is unrealistic, and it takes a long time, so if you start your attack at the wrong second, you can't even stop it, and now you have to wait like a few seconds for the animation to end. The extreme difficulty starts at the very beginning, and it's definitely hard af, and I'm saying this as someone who got all of the hoi iv achievements at one point, fair and square. Other than being stupidly hard, there is nothing fun about this game, and if you want something hard, just play chess or something like that. Video games are meant to be fun. This is not fun. Overrated af. Not to mention there is no interesting story, at least at the beginning, since I've played a bit over one hour in total. You fight against some fictional deadmen, and some weird looking 'bosses' or whatever. Also, the people who say that graphics is amazing... not really. It's pretty average. The game is close to 9 years old, so whatever, but don't expect something special in that regards either. Idk who plays this game, lol. I will get attacked by a bunch of randos, but Idc, I'm not taking back what I wrote.

“火已渐熄，然位不见王影。”宫崎英高并没有通过文本对白向我们灌输一个写好的故事，而是用混乱的村庄、残破的王城、阴暗的地牢、火祭场微弱的火光和希望，让我们去感受一个正在死亡的世界，感受末世之景的荒凉、孤寂和无言的使命。线性的推进，精妙的箱庭，残破的表达，沉浸感和氛围的塑造让《黑暗之魂3》超越了动作游戏和叙事游戏的范畴，成为一款我心目中的艺术史诗。
丧失理智的法兰不死队互相残杀，巨剑洞穿彼此的胸膛；洋葱骑士与我并肩而立，跨越重重阻难，以击杀老友的方式履行最后的誓约；修女拖着镰刀从火光中走出，背景是凄凉的音乐，楼上是不谙世事的公主，和一幅永远无法完成的画；盖尔和我在时间尽头对决，为黑暗之魂而战......我看到了一个个鲜活的角色，或是落寞的王者，失去方向的英雄，或是高歌着“赞美太阳”的骑士，不愿让少主看见黑暗的仆人......
我在环印城看到了破败的终章，死寂的末世，但仍我然忘不了在寒冷的火光中盯着绘画的少女，她曾是这个世界最后的希望：“我想画一幅画，一幅非常寒冷、黑暗、又很柔和的画。总有一天，这幅画会成为某人的容身之处......

185833432.review:
Segunda vez que tenho o prazer de jogar essa obra prima dos jogos eletrônicos, e ainda afirmo que é um dos melhores jogos que já joguei na vida!

"Mas, o que é Dark Souls?" — Vocês me perguntam!

Para mim, Dark Souls, ou melhor, "Soul's Like" é muito mais do que apenas um jogo ou um estilo de jogo. Muitas pessoas não gostam de jogos com extrema dificuldade, onde pensam que você precisa se tornar um expert no jogo, para então conseguir concluí-lo.
Afirmo com toda a certeza, que você não precisa dedicar sua vida para aprender sobre o jogo, sobre suas mecânicas e como se sair bem nele. Dark Souls parece complexo, mas tudo que você tem que fazer, é rolar!

Você, jogador, percorre um caminho repleto de inimigos. Muitos morrem com apenas alguns poucos golpes, enquanto outros levam um pouco mais de tempo, mas então chega ao tão esperado chefão. Você sabe que tem um desafio para concluir, e você entra de cabeça nisso. A boss fight começa, você golpeia o inimigo da maneira que consegue, esquiva de seus golpes e magias, se cura caso tenha tomado algum ataque, e quem sabe até você acabe perdendo a luta.
Você volta até a última fogueira, e o que faz depois disso? Você percorre todo o caminho novamente, confiante, com sangue nos olhos. Você quer derrotar aquele chefe, você quer recuperar suas almas, e o mais importante: Você quer avançar no jogo!

Para mim, Dark Souls é uma experiência de superação. Você sabe que seu inimigo é dezenas de vezes mais fortes que você, mas ainda assim você encara o desafio. Você é derrotado, inúmeras vezes, mas a motivação te faz retornar até ele e enfrentá-lo novamente. Podem levar uma, duas, três, dez ou até mais de vinte tentativas, mas você não desiste, você continua retornando e decorando cada movimento do inimigo, desviando com maestria de cada um de seus ataques, e no ápice da batalha, o mundo ao seu redor evaporou, sobrando apenas você e o inimigo, um de frente para o outro, em uma batalha que dita o rumo de sua jornada.
Você finalmente desfere seu golpe fatal, finalizando aquele que te causou tanta raiva, que lhe deu tanto trabalho, aquele que parecia ser impossível de derrotar, mas você finalmente conseguiu. Agora, aproveite a sensação, o dever cumprido, o obstáculo superado. Olhe para si mesmo, para tudo que adquiriu de conhecimento, para todo seu esforço, sua dedicação e força de vontade. Parabéns, você chegou ao topo!

Obrigado, FromSoftware!
11/10

185828923.review:
This is my least favorite of the main Dark Souls trilogy, but it's still quite good. The 100% grind is quite painful (I got the rings from a friend, or my playtime would be significantly longer) and there are some animation bugs that were never fixed. This also represents the beginning of bosses faking out the player, or what Elden Ring players get upset about with irregular swing timings and unrealistic movements etc. That never really bothered me, but it's notable. The Ashes of War (or weapon abilities) were also solidified here. Previously they were limited to specific weapons, but now most weapons have one. The PvP is also cancer. People are much more polite in the first two games, but in 3 anything goes and people are usually quite rude. The large number of summons also leads to fight club phenomena. Hacking also used to be an atrocious issue with save injection and other issues. I did a little PvP since the servers came back online to get the darkmoon miracle and didn't notice those issues again, so maybe they've been fixed. Might be worth looking into though.

All this being said, this is still a good game, and I would say it has a higher degree of polish or consistent quality compared to the previous two titles. It just personally doesn't really grab me the same way. I'm not really sure why that is. It's definitely worth playing, but I would play the other games over this one.

PROS:
-It has the Nameless King, best boss fight in the series so far (I haven't played ER or Sekiro, yet)

-Quests are way too specific, I saw a reel the other day mocking DS quests, and it lives rent-free in my head ever since (I'm looking at you, Yellowfinger Heysel)

Overall, I rate this game a Skill Issue/Git Gud.

개인적으로 1이랑 2보다 길찾기가 어렵고, 전투 난이도는 생각보다 그렇게 어렵진 않음.

185770940.review:
前作が楽しかったとか同じ会社の作品が面白かったとか、なにか特別な理由があって購入するというのであれば購入したらいいと思います。

お勧めしない点
1.水平が安定しない
FPSとかやった人にはわかると思いますが狙撃ゲームはマウスとキーボードのほうが操作しやすいのでそれで操作しますし移動しても視点の水平移動をうまく調整してくれているので酔わないんですが、このゲームはそのつもりでやるとモロに酔います。マウスの上下動作がそのまま移動に反映してしまっているんでマウスで向きを変えながら移動すると頭を上下に揺らしながら移動している感覚になります。最新作のエルデンリングでは対処されているので最初はそちらから買うことをお勧めします。

2.しぶい
指輪という装備品の効果が他作や前作と違ってとてもしぶい。つけていてもあまり変化がないような機能が盛りだくさん。さすがにひんしゅくをかったようでDLC版では効果倍増も出てきますが。

3.ラスボスより途中の中ボスのほうが強い
最後はあっけらかんと終わります。途中の倒さなくてもいい中ボス倒すだけのためにレベル追加で50以上あげさせておいてそれでも倒せないとか訳の分からないことしないといけません。

185748220.review:
[h2] İlk Soulslike oyunum olması dışında bir problem yok. Küçükken ilk boss olan Iudex Gundyr’i bile kesemezken, şimdi ilk oynadığımda yakın çevremden yardım alarak oyunu bitirdim. Sonrasında NG+7 kez yaparak oyunun tüm keyfini çıkarıp bitirdim. Oyundaki başarımları yapmak için birden fazla karakter açıp onlarla devam etmek zorunda kalmak biraz sıkıntılı bir durum, ancak aşabileceğiniz bir şey.
Daha önce de belirttiğim gibi, bu benim ilk Soulslike oyunum ve kendisi Souls türündeki en kolay oyunlardan biri. Eğer oyunu oynamayı düşünüyorsanız DLC’lerini de alıp tam sürüm şekilde oynamanızı tavsiye ederim. Ben iki DLC ile oynayarak epey vakit harcadım. Oyunun devamı, zaten DLC’lerle daha keyifli hale geliyor. Daha zor bosslar, hikayenin ilerleyişine katkı ve genel anlamda çeşitlilik, oyunu oldukça zevkli bir deneyime dönüştürüyor. [/h2] 

Oyunun hikayesinin 2016 yılına göre çok zengin olması, grafikleri ve diyalogları, kesinlikle etkileyici. Eğer bu oyunu alıp oynayacaksanız, hikayesini detaylı bir şekilde takip etmenizi tavsiye ederim. Rastgele bulunan itemlerdeki hikayeler bile deneyiminize çok şey katabilir.
Tarih olarak 16 Ocak 2025’te, NG+7 karakterimi geride bırakıp oyuna yeniden başladım ve Solaire of Astora cosplay yaparak oyunu bir kez daha bitirdim. Bu süreçte yeniden büyük keyif aldım. İşte bu yüzden bu oyunu seviyorum.

| Hikaye: 

Çok zengin bir hikayesi olmasının dışında, bütün oyunlarının da hikayesini bilip oynamanızı tavsiye ederim, çünkü ilk oyundan bu oyuna göndermeli birkaç şey bulunmakta: Bölge, karakter, mob, item vs.

| Oynanış: 

Oynanışı gayet keyifli ve basit. Pontiff Sulyvahn'a kadar geldiyseniz, oyunun mekaniklerine ve oynanış türüne alışmışsınızdır demektir.

| Grafikler ve Atmosfer: 

Bossların müzikleri, etraftaki atmosferler vs. hepsinin mükemmel bir şekilde yapıldığını düşünüyorum. Grafiklerinin hepsinin güzellikleri ve tuhaf bir görüntüleri var, ama tuhaflıkları oyunu oynamaya engel değil.

| Dip Not: 

Oyunun müziklerine takılıp kalabilirsiniz. Ana menü müziği, ikinci faz müziği olan Vordt of the Boreal Valley’in müziği ve popüler "Memes" müziği olduğunu bilmenizi isterim. Ayrıca Soul of Cinder’in ikinci faz müziğinin mükemmelliği beni benden alıyor. Keserken bile üzülerek kesiyorum. Dark Souls 1 efsanesine gönderme yapıyor o boss'un hareketleri, kullandığı silahın davranışları vs.

| Çeşitli Karakter Yapıları ve Yenilikçi Oynanış Seçenekleri:

Oyunun sunduğu karakter gelişim sistemi oldukça özgür. Farklı karakter yapıları deneyerek, her seferinde farklı bir oyun tarzı yaşamak mümkün.

| DLC :

DLC'ler, ana oyunun hikayesine mükemmel bir şekilde entegre edilmiş ve ekstra zorluklar ekleyerek deneyimi daha da zenginleştiriyor. Nameless King'in Yeni Elden Ring Oyununda gelmesini de göz önüne katarsak iki oyunun alternatif  bir oyunu geliyor ve OYUNDA FIRE KEEPER DA VAR

| Mod Desteği :

Dark Souls 3'ün topluluğu oldukça aktif ve mod desteği sayesinde oyun deneyimi daha da özelleştirilebiliyor. Ben genellikle rastgele mob modunu daha çok tercih edip seviyorum ve rastgele item modunu da. 
👍 10/10 Bir Oyun.

185730651.review: Replaying the first Dark Souls made me realize how much of a straight line this game is. This game isn't as advanced on its level design compared to the first Dark Souls, but has more weapons to choose from depending on whichever category you want to head towards (Strength, Dexterity, etc.). Chances are you won't like Dark Souls Remastered as much if you played this game first, but I'll recommend you look into it. Overall this game is relatively easy to progress (and I don't mean that in terms of difficulty, 'cause you'll die a lot) and friendlier to a new player getting into Souls. Definitely recommend!

185685670.review:
Coming back to this after a few years and it is still a blast to play.  The main campaign  is great with the classic From progression and learning curve.  Controls are responsive and weighty.  The world design is creepy and fantastic.  Music is epic.  Story is based more n showing than telling. 

 It is not perfect though. One side-boss towards the end of the main campaign is an atrocity with massive camera issues and an annoying first phase to get to the hard part.  I also am not as happy with the DLC because its difficulty feels cheaper with more  tedium and ranged sections that distract from exploration and are more annoying than fun. 

Overall nearly a decade later, it is a solid fun game.  Thumbs up.

185663670.review:
Глава 1
«Начало»

Был непростой день, именно поэтому я решил лечь спать около одиннадцати часов вечера. 

Наступило утро. В девять часов я заметил, что у меня болит живот, дабы не обосрать свои трусы, я сел на толчок. Чуть-чуть натужившись, я почувствовал теплую жижу, медленно спускавшуюся по моей правой булке. Так как я не новичок в этой сфере, я тут же понял, что это за необычайной мерзотности жижа течет по моим булочкам.

Это было gоvно.

Глава 2.
«Черного змея не будет»

Я начал потихоньку открывать свое очко для жижеиспускания, проливая где-то две или три сотни миллилитров за раз. Желание мастурбировать отсутствовало, потребность в еде росла с каждой секундой. Благо аппетит напрочь отбивало вонище, эпицентром которого была моя жопа…

В тот момент я сказал себе: «Держись, держись!». И это были не пустые слова. Так как дефикация с обильным выделением жидкого кала продолжалась.

Глава 3
«Жидкий пук»

Шел второй час, я выпустил большую часть кала, приходилось уже напрягать свою жопу. Выделение кала приостановилось. Я вздохнул с облегчением, но все же решил натужиться ещё один раз. Этот раз оказался фатальным…

Я пукнул. А точнее перданул и не просто, а обильно даванув жижи под себя. Мою жопу в прямом смысле порвало, туалет из черного превратился в мерзотнокоричневый и все во круг меня резко затихло…

«Где я?» - произнес детский голос издалека

«Как я сюда попал?»

Тьма…

185646039.review:
称之为魂系列的集大成之作未免有些夸张，但绝对算得上是最适合入坑的一部魂。
  大体上继承了前作们的积累与经验，同时为后来的法环提供了个框架，适当的“难度安慰剂”也更加照顾新人玩家。举例来说就是战技系统，既是对前作特殊重击的继承，也是法环强力战技们的雏形，既有“准备架势”这样的功能性战技，也有“忍耐”这样的数值怪。玩完之后不管是向前探索交界地的广阔世界，还是向后探索初火兴衰交替的历史都能有一个良好的基础。
  而即使抛开这个承前启后的作用，魂三也是款不错的游戏，也许它的优点不像前作那样凸出，创新点和开创性没带来太多惊艳，但缺点却在巨人的肩膀上得到了补足，不至于太过劝退，让人失去探索后面世界的欲望；四平八稳的设计也并没有让它失去魂系的黑暗厚重，而是如同终乐章般回顾前尘后毅然走向终点画上句号。最重要的是，魂系主题一直没变：走过这么多路，看过这么多人，他们有的留下，有的消失，最后剩下的，只有你的选择。
  如果你是第一次入坑魂三的新人，建议选择骑士出身。一身足以支撑到通关的中甲，一把名字平平无奇实则位居同类武器前列的长剑，一面战技弹反略有瑕疵但物理减伤率百分百的中盾，以及更高血精力敏和负重的初始点数，它们都并非不可或缺，但都能或多或少地改善你的体验。当你学会举起盾牌绕着敌人观察它们行为，学会放下盾牌让自己的精力正常恢复，知道自己该给出剑和翻滚留下多少余地，恭喜，你已经真正踏入这个走向黑暗的世界了。而这也是魂系主题的一部分：剑与盾都不是最重要的，最重要的是玩家，最重要的是踏入这里的你。
  Let the sun shine upon this Lord of Cinder!

185640654.review:
Dark Souls 3 é uma [i]pedrada[/i] de jogo e uma ótima culminação da série como um todo.

Sendo o terceiro e mais avançado tecnologicamente da trilogia, a experiencia de jogar é incrivelmente fluída e nada menos que impecável, trabalhando junto com uma incrível direção artística que induz uma mistura de triunfo e melancolia para os olhos de quem joga. É aparente quanto o mundo está deplorável devido aos ciclos de ascensão da chama, o que traduz bem o sentimento de desgasto e saturação de algo que devia descansar já faz um bom tempo.

Enquanto ele seguiu o caminho de um mundo com progressão mais linear, os níveis por si estão claramente um passo à frente de seu antecessor. Áreas como a Catedral das Profundezas sendo completamente navegável a partir de apenas 1 fogueira, o malabarismo mental que a Irithyll Dungeon induz com seu labirinto e os incríveis cenários do Castelo Lothric retorna um pouco aquele level Design do DS1 que eu tanto sinto falta. Embora eu ache que tem simplesmente muitas áreas de "pântano" enfiadas nesse jogo.

Por fim, é impossível falar de DS3 sem mencionar a cereja do bolo: os Bosses. Comparado aos 2 Souls anteriores, os bosses desse jogo ganham de lavada, tanto em complexidade quanto dificuldade. Sendo o Souls mais rápido mecanicamente, eles conseguiram aproveitar bastante este aspecto com seus bosses dinâmicos e responsivos, até aqueles do início do jogo podem te causar problemas caso não possua os reflexos necessários. Os Bosses do meio pro final do jogo então? Cinema demais.

Embora todas as suas qualidades, o jogo possui sim seus defeitos. É correto assumir que ele se afasta consideravelmente da fórmula original, onde planejar seus encontros com um combate mais lento e metódico era o foco. Ironicamente, sinto que é o Souls que mais se carrega no trabalho de seus antecessores, ele não inovou tanto em questão das mecânicas em si, e tentar jogar com uma build em mente com uma progressão tão linear pode ser cansativo e deveras paia.

Mas em suma, Dark Souls 3 é um desfecho perfeito para a série, conseguindo ser bastante memorável quanto agradável de se jogar.

Могу рекомендовать как первый Souls в вашей жизни
Из минусов: плохая камера и таргет - (Пример это великое древо, да, я понимаю что рука, яйца, это не отдельный моб чтобы захватывать в таргет. Но если вы петух хгхг, маг, если вы маг то будет сложно), пока что  это минусы которые бросаются в глаза, и бесят, остальные минусы для обывателя скорее фишка жанра и что-то новое в его клавиатурной жизни.
Из плюсов: Баланс (игровой и механика), - стан вешается не только на игрока, но и на мобов. Если вы пропустили удар от крестьянина, то скорее всего получите целую серию, это работает и на крестьянине соответственно. Взяв большой топор драконоборца, вы будете вгонять рядовых противников в стан после первого удара, и тем самым не отпустите его до окончания стамины (не работает на большинстве боссах, и плохо работает на огромных крестьян)
Боссы - практически каждый босс является уникальным противником, и скорее всего не оставит вас без эмоций, негативных или положительных. Если я после Чемпиона Гундира не испытала вообще нечего, босс багнутый, он у меня несколько раз просто бегал по арене кругом, атаковал воздух возле себя). И после Танцовщицы я испытала максимальное удовольствие, босс плавный, даёт себя ударить как минимум 2 раза без атаки, её атаки в большинстве предсказуемые. Её танец это отдельный вид искусства, так же как и её жопа))) (но у неё есть багнутый захват, лично у меня он работал как нужно)
Из ещё плюсов це - Сигвард ( ну это база), Сюжетка Анри, Хранительница Огня, Йоршка, и Юрия ( она прикольная)
Пока что это главные плюсы для меня, игра прекрасна, со своими минусами и плюсами, но для меня минусов намного меньше чем плюсов.
НЕ РЕКОМЕНДУЮ: НЕ ПАРИРУЙТЕ, для первого прохождения это БЕСПОЛЕЗНО И СУКА СЛОЖНО. Нужно минимум 10 часов просто парируя, чтобы хоть немного понять как и где, и каждый босс парируется в разные моменты окон, Понтифик и Гундир парируются ВООБЩЕ ПО РАЗНОМУ

I originally bought this game because a friend of mine called it "his favorite game," and I wanted to play it for quite a while at that point. After I died at Iudex like 20 times, I stopped playing for a while. A few weeks passed, and I gave it another try. It was a great decision. Even though this was my first Souls game, I didn’t get absolutely crushed, and it was actually a very enjoyable experience (well, except for a few bosses and covenant farming). The world has its unique charm, and most of the enemies feel fair and balanced. Besides the covenant rewards, the collectibles are fun to collect, and they are not locked behind some super complicated questlines, which is something I like. When it comes to progression, it feels like there are almost no spikes in difficulty throughout the entire game. There are a lot, and I mean a LOT, of possible builds you can make when combining character attributes, weapons, many kinds of spells, and rings. The combat is very good. The OST is an absolute banger, and it makes the atmosphere during boss fights even more intense.
It was a powerful journey.

Now onto DS1 :)

185590798.review:
极其惊艳、极其沉浸的一段火之末世的旅程。与盖尔、薪王化身、修女、无名校长、沙院长诸多优秀BOSS的对战真是酣畅淋漓，大书库、幽邃教堂的地图设计更是巧妙且优美，洋葱哥、帕奇、安里的支线设计也是令人动容。虽然黑魂三已经发售快9年，但无论美术还是游戏性，都依然适合这个时代。
不过我觉得比较遗憾的是“吃神”艾尔德利奇的设计，以及地下监牢和绘画世界这两场图的设计。
吃神给人的感觉有些神鬼二象性，作为薪王，他攻击手段显得不够大气、不够配上“吞噬神明”给人带来很有b格的感觉——除了他那无赖一般、具有几乎秒杀能力的箭雨。给人的感觉就是从幽邃教堂一路铺垫到亚诺尔隆德，作为幽邃——冷冽谷势力信仰的末世的神以及救世主，他的震撼感远不如薪王化身、无名这种信仰源头级别的究极BOSS，除了可以和安里联手一战外，连单独的CG都没有——比起其他几位差得远了。
地下监牢和绘画世界是同样的问题，它们都是极其优秀的地图（除了鸦村教堂二楼那个无意义的门），终极BOSS也同样兼顾演出性与战斗趣味性——如果没有那赤石一样的堆怪那么设计几乎是完美的。但是会扣血上限、一戳控到死的狱卒与数值不低、密度多到爆炸的雪原狼&法兰幽魂&米尔伍德骑士的无脑堆砌毁了这两张图！堆怪事真的抽象且恶心。
另外点名表扬薪王化身、双王子、盖尔和修女，对比后来惊天地泣鬼神的米塔恩这几位设计的实在太完美了。。。化身和盖尔都属于攻击欲望极高的那种，但一个控制了数值，一个给足了回合；双王子也是双人战，但无论从战斗模式还是设定上都很容易接受；修女虽然读指令、有大连段，但韧性丢人。他们都比较难难但是都留足了反制手段。比起来米塔恩的设计真是。。。惊天地泣鬼神，我只有这个形容。
最后，我真的很喜欢洋葱哥和盖尔爷爷的剧情设计，他们都是极其优秀、富有魅力的战士，同他们战斗——无论是友还是敌，都能感受到这种魅力。To your valour, my sword, and our sworn duties! Long may the sun shine!!!
（以及表白防火女脑婆，我喜欢你QWQ。另外FS社你们那个b大型Boss的索敌能不能优化优化！！！米宝和风暴鸡打起来难受的要死！！！）

185539310.review:
The video game industry is vast and varied, with countless genres, styles, and experiences available for players worldwide. However, among the immense catalog of titles, Dark Souls 3 stands out as a transcendent experience that deserves to be titled the best game ever made. From its intricate world-building and atmospheric storytelling to its challenging combat and deep lore, Dark Souls 3 combines these elements in a way that captivates players and immerses them into its unforgiving world. The game's design, philosophy, and enduring impact have made it a definitive masterpiece, one that continually influences and inspires the gaming landscape.

Challenging, Rewarding Combat

One of the most iconic features of the Dark Souls series, and specifically Dark Souls 3, is its combat. The game is renowned for its difficulty, which requires players to master both the timing and the stamina management of their character. Every enemy encounter is a test of precision, patience, and skill. The combat is not about button-mashing or spamming attacks; it’s about understanding the rhythm of battle, reading enemy movements, and responding accordingly. The feeling of accomplishment that comes from defeating a tough boss or overcoming a difficult area is unparalleled. Unlike most games, Dark Souls 3 does not hold the player's hand. Every victory feels earned, and this sense of accomplishment is one of the game's strongest draws.

The variety of weapons and playstyles available in Dark Souls 3 further enriches its combat. Players can choose between heavy, slow weapons or fast, dexterous ones, each with its own strengths and weaknesses. Magic, pyromancy, and faith-based abilities also add layers of strategy to the gameplay. This flexibility allows players to tailor their approach to combat, creating a highly personalized experience that rewards experimentation and mastery.

World-Building and Environmental Storytelling

Another aspect that makes Dark Souls 3 so remarkable is its world-building. The game's setting, Lothric, is a desolate, decaying world where the flame that sustains life is flickering out. From the moment players step into the game, they are met with an overwhelming sense of atmosphere and tension. The architecture, the enemies, and the environments all tell a story of a once-great kingdom now on the brink of collapse.

What sets Dark Souls 3 apart from many other games is the way it conveys its lore. The game doesn’t provide exposition through long cutscenes or dialogues. Instead, it leaves pieces of the story scattered throughout the world for players to discover themselves. The locations are interconnected, and clues to the past can be found in the architecture, item descriptions, and the lore of the characters you encounter. This method of environmental storytelling is not only immersive, but it also encourages players to pay attention to their surroundings and piece together the narrative at their own pace.

The interconnected world of Dark Souls 3 is a work of art in its own right. The areas are meticulously designed, with hidden paths, secret rooms, and shortcuts that reward curiosity. Lothric is a world that feels alive, yet decayed, and the haunting beauty of its landscapes adds to the melancholy tone of the game. From the fiery ruins of the high walls to the eerie cathedral of the deep, each location tells its own tragic story, inviting players to explore every nook and cranny.

Philosophical Depth and Themes

The thematic richness of Dark Souls 3 is another factor that elevates it above other games. The central theme of the game revolves around the cyclical nature of life and death. The fire that sustains life is fading, and the world is slowly decaying, yet the characters in the game are determined to preserve it. This tension between preservation and decay runs throughout the entire narrative and manifests in the actions and motivations of the game's key figures.

The story of Dark Souls 3 revolves around the concept of "linking the fire," a ritual that keeps the flame alive and prolongs the world's existence. However, this ritual also brings suffering, as those who sacrifice themselves to the fire are condemned to an eternity of burning. In this way, Dark Souls 3 explores existential questions about the nature of sacrifice, the meaning of life, and the inevitability of death. The game doesn’t offer easy answers but instead leaves these questions for the player to contemplate as they progress.

This philosophical depth is what gives Dark Souls 3 its emotional resonance. It’s a game that challenges the player’s understanding of life and death and forces them to grapple with difficult moral decisions. The characters you meet along the way, whether allies or enemies, are all dealing with their own struggles and dilemmas. The game presents a world where hope is scarce, but it’s still possible to find meaning through perseverance and determination.

Enduring Impact on Gaming

Since its release in 2016, Dark Souls 3 has had a profound influence on the gaming industry. Its combination of difficult gameplay, intricate world-building, and philosophical themes has inspired countless developers and players. Many games have adopted elements from the Dark Souls series, such as challenging combat, interconnected worlds, and non-linear storytelling. The term "Souls-like" has become a genre unto itself, and Dark Souls 3 remains the gold standard by which all other games in this category are judged.

Furthermore, the game’s community continues to thrive, with players discussing strategies, uncovering hidden secrets, and sharing experiences. The game's online components, including invasions and co-op play, encourage player interaction in a way that few other games can match. The sense of camaraderie that emerges from helping others overcome difficult challenges is one of the many reasons Dark Souls 3 remains beloved by its fanbase.

Conclusion

In the world of video games, few titles achieve the level of excellence that Dark Souls 3 has attained. Its combination of challenging gameplay, deep lore, atmospheric world-building, and philosophical themes make it an experience unlike any other. The sense of accomplishment in overcoming its challenges, the joy of discovering its secrets, and the emotional weight of its narrative all contribute to making Dark Souls 3 the best game ever. It’s a game that demands respect, rewards perseverance, and leaves a lasting impression on everyone who steps into its dark and unforgiving world.

185510531.review:
Dark Souls III is everything on the outside, that is claims to be on the inside. 

Dark Souls III is a bleak, grey, melancholy conclusion to a trilogy that defined an era. To me, Dark Souls III is the weakest entry in the trilogy but one that serves its purpose perfectly. Without spoilers, Dark Souls III constantly paints a picture of a world run raw by its repeating nature. Characters, Items, and Locations from games that (lore-wise) took place thousands of years ago, reappear with no mention of how they have arrived, they share only one detail amongst them. All of these things are tired, and caught in a neverending cycle. This feeling is pushed onto the player through all of the recycled material and overall bleak and grey atmosphere the game provides.

Dark Souls III is as much a game as it is a commentary about the series as a whole, as great as it has been, the formula has become stale, and it's time to stop it now and move on to something new. If you have played Dark Souls I and Dark Souls II, Dark Souls III is a must play in order to conclude your adventure.

185449638.review:
финальный финал великолепной трилогии игровой индустрии...

в этой части изумительно проработали музыкальное сопровождение для каждого босса, тебе начинает нравиться чуть ли не каждая музыкальная тема босса. действительно, хороший конец для такой хорошей франшизы, как дарк солс. особенно мелодия, называемая Epilogue, так и бьет в сердце, накидывая флешбеки прохождений как самой третьей части, так и прошлых частей.

печально то, что, по моему мнению, душу пепла не столь хорошо сделали в качестве фин. босса, сколь сделали с гвином, фин. боссом первой части. вот серьезно, в первой части в самом интро нам давали знать, кто является самым главным и последним боссом в игре, а про душу пепла на протяжении самой тройки (дс3) ни единой речи. конечно, интересный мувсет и концепт в том, что это прошлые повелители пепла, скомканные в одну душу, но все же он больше ощущается как ноунейм перс без сюжетки особо таковой. а вот про рыцаря-раба гаэля можно сказать, что он больше подходит как финальный босс, ведь битва идет между двумя обладателями темной души. великолепный файт двумя словами. и даже предыстория хорошо описана для этого персонажа.

тем не менее, я благодарен фромам за такую легендарную трилогию, действительно все хорошо началось, пошло (если не считать отдельные приколы от дс2) и закончилось.

185437208.review:
Я люблю серию Dark Souls. Не могу назвать эту серию просто играми, для меня это искусство и лекарство от хандры. Хоть это и темное фэнтези, и порой горит жопа, но в целом проходить игру очень приятно.

Мне очень нравится визуал этой игры. Он настолько хорош, что я даже не знаю как его описать. А еще в игре потрясающая музыка. Конечно, по-началу она может восприниматься непривычно, но чем больше ее слушаешь, тем больше начинаешь эту музыку любить.

Геймплей в этой части стал динамичнее, меньше багов, больше оружия и заклинаний. Одна из причин перепроходить игру - это попробовать разное оружие и билды.

Противники разнообразные, интересные. А вот боссы просто топ. Они все уникальные, и к ним нужен разный подход. Например, Оцейрос очень быстро атакует, и от атак тяжело уворачиваться. Но если защищаться щитом, то босс становится легким. Когда выясняешь слабое место босса самостоятельно - это кайф.

По поводу минусов:
- Плохой неткод.
- Противники в DLC душноватные. Некоторые противники замахиваются и ждут некоторое время перед атакой (привет Елден Ринг).
- Квесты персонажей очень интересные, но пройти их без гайдов невозможно. Например, чтобы пройти некоторые квесты, надо вернуться в те места локации, которые ты уже прошел (догадаться до этого невозможно).
- Иногда приходиться паркурить (это больно).

Сюжет великолепный, но разбираться в нем самому довольно тяжело. Персонажи тоже отличные. Их история трогает за душу. А закончить этот обзор я хочу цитатой: "Береги себя, слышишь? Иначе все мои усилия будут напрасны..."

The gameplay can be so immersive and the combat system is hard but really fun once you've found your own rythm

185436238.review:
Dark Souls 3 – A Masterclass in Challenge, Storytelling, and Immersion

Dark Souls 3, developed by FromSoftware, is a crowning achievement in both design and storytelling. As a continuation of the series, it combines the best elements of its predecessors while refining mechanics and delivering a deeply immersive experience that challenges players in both skill and patience. If you're ready to dive into one of the most rewarding, atmospheric, and challenging games ever made, then Dark Souls 3 should be at the top of your list.

Story & Characters:
The narrative in Dark Souls 3 is, as with previous titles, deliberately fragmented and steeped in lore. The story revolves around the "Linking of the Fire," a recurring theme throughout the series. Players take on the role of the Ashen One, a chosen being destined to either rekindle the fire or allow the age of dark to begin. This overarching plot is simple on the surface but reveals layers of complexity through the game's environment, NPCs, and subtle clues.

The characters are some of the most memorable in the series. From the enigmatic Fire Keeper, who tends to your bonfires and offers cryptic guidance, to the tragic Siegward of Catarina, each character is rich with personality, history, and purpose. NPC dialogue is often minimal but laden with meaning, pushing players to piece together their motivations and destinies through exploration.

Exploration & World Design:
Exploration is at the heart of Dark Souls 3, and it rewards patience and careful observation. The interconnected world is masterfully designed, with areas that loop back on themselves, creating a sense of unity and discovery. From the decrepit Cathedral of the Deep to the eerie ruins of Lothric, each location feels unique and filled with secrets. Every corner hides items, hidden passages, or lore that further deepens the player's understanding of the world.

One of the game's greatest achievements is how it handles verticality and secrets. Areas that seem unreachable often become accessible later, after uncovering shortcuts or abilities. The layout of the world invites players to explore every nook and cranny, as every item, every door, and every hidden path is part of a greater puzzle. The rewards for exploration are tangible—from powerful weapons to lore-drenched artifacts.

Mechanics & Difficulty:
Dark Souls 3's core gameplay revolves around tight, deliberate combat that rewards careful timing and patience. The combat system is highly flexible, offering a wide array of weapons, armor, and spells that allow for various playstyles. Whether you prefer to engage with a giant sword, a fast dual-wielding build, or a sorcery-focused mage, the game offers tools for almost any playstyle. The magic system is deep and varied, with multiple schools of sorcery, pyromancy, and miracles to experiment with.

At its core, combat is about rhythm and patience. Every fight feels like a duel, whether you're battling a lowly enemy or a massive boss. Learning enemy attack patterns, timing your dodges and parries, and understanding the weight of your gear are essential. The game's difficulty is unrelenting but fair. Each death teaches something valuable—whether it’s about the terrain, the enemies, or your own limits.

Playstyles & Patience:
One of the most notable features of Dark Souls 3 is the range of viable playstyles. While many games constrain you to specific character builds, Dark Souls 3 offers the freedom to craft abilities and equipment to suit your preferences. Whether you focus on dexterity and agility, heavy tanking, or long-range magic, every playthrough feels distinct.

The game’s difficulty, often seen as a hallmark of the series, forces you to slow down and think critically. Learning enemy behaviors, taking note of environmental cues, and planning ahead are key to success. Death is not just a setback but a lesson, reinforcing the need for patience and adaptability. Through its challenges, Dark Souls 3 teaches perseverance and rewards determination with immense satisfaction.

Conclusion:
Dark Souls 3 is not just a game; it’s an experience. It’s a test of your skill, patience, and resilience. The characters, story, and world are meticulously crafted, and the combat is rewarding and unforgiving. Through its difficulty, the game teaches that progress comes not through brute force but understanding and adaptability. If you’re ready to embrace its challenges, Dark Souls 3 offers one of the most satisfying experiences in modern gaming.

185418093.review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Dark Souls 3... O ápice da genialidade humana no desenvolvimento artístico de uma obra até o ano de 2016.
Fiz a platina, cheguei ao NG3 e continuo jogando porque é simplesmente fantástico, é o tipo de jogo que eu tenho vontade de zerar inúmeras vezes sem enjoar. Bosses de personalidades únicas, cenários que fazem qualquer homem chorar e uma trilha sonora que vibra na alma são apenas algumas das coisas que a Fromsoftware nos entrega com Dark Souls 3.

Um jogo mecanicamente simples porém profundamente complexo em arte, diversas vezes parei o jogo para admirar o lugar e enrolei algumas fights para ouvir mais um pouco da trilha sonora e tudo já começa no menu ao apertar Start. A música do menu... lembro-me da primeira vez que abri o jogo e fiquei hipnotizado com a trilha da tela inicial e naquele momento eu soube do magnífico jogo que eu estava prestes a iniciar... 
Joguem Dark Souls 3 senhoras e senhores, joguem Dark Souls 3.

185382583.review:
DARK SOULS III
Great game. Dying repeatedly has never been this much fun. Wouldn’t change a thing.

ASHES OF ARIANDEL
Not too bad, except for the Champion's Gravetender and Sif from Wish, who exists solely to remind you you're trash. Could've been better if it was longer.

RINGED CITY
Step 1: Enter the DLC. Step 2: Get obliterated by angels who nuke you so hard, you start questioning your life choices. Respawn, try again. Skip them, make it to the Ringed City. Immediately get shoved off the map. Decide to have a chat with Shira, hoping for some moral support... and I immediately get bonked by a ogre mid-conversation.
Midir? Oh, yeah, I turned him into a pincushion with arrows. Thought I won, but then he reminded me he’s basically Bayle on steroids. Plus, the camera decided to team up with Midir, just to make sure I had no chance of surviving. After 500 deaths and tears, I reach Gael.
Gael. One of my favorite boss fights in DS3, right up there with Nameless King and Soul of Cinder. I died more than a thousand times, but honestly, I had more fun getting wrecked by him than playing with Halflight.

185381227.review:
¡FANTASÍA OSCURA EN SU PURO ESTADO Y EL MEJOR DE SU TRILOGÍA!

Dark Souls 3, redefine los anteriores dos juegos y mejora la especial estética conservando su tono oscuro que lo caracteriza, con una dificultad entrañable y que te hará sudar más de una vez con sus jefes complicados y sus enemigos poderosos, procedo a reseñarlo y a contar mi experiencia a través de diferentes apartados técnicos:

Jugabilidad:

La jugabilidad de Dark Souls 3 es rápida y mucho mejor que sus predecesores. combinaciones de ataques ligeros y pesados hace que sea mixta y variada. La resistencia a veces se te queda corta con los veloces ataques de los jefes, es mi único punto a criticar que pienso que hace falta subir mucho esta estadística para no pasarlo mal.

Mundo lineal:

Un mundo bastante directo y lineal, ayuda mucho a no perderse y siempre seguir un ritmo claro, no obstante, no vacila en utilizar la nostalgia en algunas zonas como la característica Anor Londo y otros lugares que recordaran mucho al inicio de esta trilogía. En general, tiene muy buen diseño de niveles y algunas zonas sobre todo las catacumbas se harán de rogar por su abundancia de enemigos innecesarios en mi opinión, el resto es una joya en el arte y puesta de escena alucinante.

Historia y narrativa:

La narrativa de este juego es lineal y sigue la historia de sus antiguos juegos, por lo que no tiene mucho sentido profundizar en la narrativa si no has jugado a los anteriores. Te presenta un mundo decadente y el final de la Era del Fuego y tu como Latente de ceniza te aventuraras a reunir a los señores de la ceniza y derrotarlos en un épico combate para poder enlazar la llama o usurparla siendo un no muerto.

Gráficos y diseño artístico:

Visualmente, es excelente, aunque el juego ya tiene varios años en la espalda, se conserva muy bien y no desagrada en la vista, tampoco necesitas un PC de alta gama para ejecutarlo y jugarlo, ni mucho menos, si es verdad que en mi experiencia yo lo he jugado a calidad 4K lo cual hace la experiencia más pulcra y recomiendo vivir la experiencia en alta calidad.

Banda sonora:

La banda sonora de Dark Souls 3 es sin duda su mejor apartado con diferencia, veníamos de una banda sonora en el menú de título tranquila y sosegada, en cambio en esta entrega su música es gloriosa, cada jefe tiene su gran banda sonora, es con diferencia el apartado que mejor se le da a Fromsoftware a la hora de cautivar al jugador, este apartado hace muy especial estos juegos ya que un buen juego acompañado de una buena música hace que sea veinte veces mejor la experiencia. 

Conclusión:

Dark Souls 3 es el mejor juego de su trilogía sin duda, totalmente recomendable para la gente que le atraigan los retos difíciles y la fantasía oscura y medieval. Un viaje que recordaras por mucho tiempo y una aventura sin precedentes, por último, quiero aclarar que yo vengo de jugar Bloodborne y Elden Ring, este juego no se queda para nada atrás y son los tres juegos muy excelentes y que obtienen el sobresaliente. Como siempre Fromsoftware no decepciona en desarrollar obras maestras.

185299574.review:
This is really great experience and proper epilogue for Dark Souls series. It felt more like sequel to Dark Souls I rather than third entry. Epic music with memorable, difficult but fair boss encounters, each enemy needs to be respected, many weapons and playstyles, variance in areas. 

Combat is more fluid than in first one.

Graphics and music/soundtrack are better. 

Boss fights are better. 

Design is on pair, maybe better than I. 

Lore... is there. There is some continuity and some bullshit (time and space stuff...). NPC quests are easy to miss and so is lore. At least we are not told to seek four greater souls because reasons. It's nothing too fancy but it serves it's purpose. I am tired of reading every item description to get some lore. It's literally exposition in worst way possible. Easy to miss (there are hundreds of items to pick up in game world), need to check each description and match it to other. I just don't think it's good type of story. Lore is interesting by storytelling is lacking severly. But I guess this is what they decided to roll with. There is slightly more NPC interation and these seem more meaningful. 

Overall, great game. I will rate it 9/10 and would definitely recommend every fantasy fan to try out. One point is for story I would love to experience. And better story as everything starts to converge at one point is kinda meh.

185296146.review:
After playing the souls trilogy and Elden Ring, I can confidently say that this is the best game out of the four, and one of my favorites ever.

The world and levels are beautifully crafted, full of secrets, the general quality of bosses is astounding, the music is incredible as well and bringes this game to another level.

Theres decent build variety, and a long list of weapons, armours, rings and spells to experiment.

It's a 9/10 game for me, and it's so cool to see that after 8 years it released, you'll find active players and new ones, looking to learn it.
Difficult and complex for sure, but if you're looking for a challenge, I higly advise you to buy it, either for the story or only the gameplay, still valid today.

185234520.review:
A Triumphant Finale!
Dark Souls 3 is everything a finale to the Souls series should be: grand, haunting, and packed with unforgettable moments. 
It’s a love letter to fans of the series, a culmination of its best elements, and a fitting end to the dark, enigmatic world of Lordran and its many fallen kingdoms.
Right from the start, Dark Souls 3 impresses with its pace and polish. 
The combat is faster and more fluid than ever, seamlessly blending the deliberate precision of the original Dark Souls with the agility of Bloodborne! 
Every swing of your weapon, roll, and spell cast feels tight and responsive, making battles as exhilarating as they are challenging.
The world design is breathtaking, offering a mix of new areas and nostalgic callbacks. 
Lothric is a sprawling, interconnected realm filled with gothic spires, cursed swamps, and decaying ruins. 
From the terrifying descent into the Abyssal Cathedral to the melancholy beauty of the snow-covered Irithyll, every location is dripping with atmosphere and storytelling.
Boss battles are, as expected, a major highlight. 
Each encounter is crafted with care, offering unique challenges that test your skill and patience. 
From the ethereal grace of the Dancer of the Boreal Valley to the sheer ferocity of the Nameless King, the bosses are as memorable as they are brutal. 
And for those seeking an even greater challenge, the DLCs deliver some of the most intense fights in the series.
What sets Dark Souls 3 apart is its sense of finality. 
The game is rich with lore and nods to the previous entries, tying up threads and deepening the series’ overarching themes of cycles, decay, and the struggle to break free from fate. 
It’s a story that resonates deeply, especially for longtime fans who’ve followed the series from the beginning.
Visually, the game is stunning, with detailed environments, intricate character designs, and a rich, oppressive atmosphere that perfectly complements the game’s tone. 
While it may not reinvent the formula, Dark Souls 3 refines it to near perfection. 
It’s a game that rewards exploration, persistence, and mastery, offering a journey that feels as epic as it does personal. 
For newcomers, it’s a challenging but accessible entry point into the series. 
For veterans, it’s a bittersweet farewell to one of gaming’s most iconic franchises! 
Dark Souls 3 is a testament to the enduring brilliance of the series, a dark and beautiful masterpiece that reminds us why we fell in love with these games in the first place.

185209160.review:
After having played Demon's Souls, Dark Souls, Dark Souls II SotFS and Elden Ring, I can safely say that this game is definitely my favourite so far. The gameplay is a massive step-up in quality compared to the 2 previous Dark Souls games, feeling more fluid and satisfying. The combat options feel more diverse with the new dual wield weapons (I think this method is better than the one in DS2 and ER) allowing for some neat combos and a whole new style of combat. The bosses are really fun and they're really memorable (Wolnir, Yhorm and Curse-Rotted Greatwood are an exception but they ain't really bad they're just less fun compared to the rest), showing amazing bosses like Soul of Cinder, Slave Knight Gael, Pontiff Sulyvahn and many others. The level design is more straightforward (very much welcome after the confusing design of DS2) but I would like it a bit more if it took DS1's approach (still good level design tho). The music, as always is incredible. Yuka Kitamura and Motoi Sakuraba never fail to provide an amazing listening experience.

All and all, I would say this game is a solid 9.5/10. I'll definitely revisit it many more times whenever I'm looking to have some good fun.

185208404.review:
[h1] Ahhh... Peak [/h1]

Dark Souls 3 is without a doubt my favorite of the Dark Souls trilogy. 
It's a great game, improving on all the aspects from previous DS games,

I'll talk about each aspect individually for the most part:

The aesthetic and visuals of this game are unmatched, holy shit this game is beautiful, being inspired by Berserk and using a lot of elements from it, like the eclipse, which looks phenomenal in game. 

The ost is amazing as always

The bosses are incredibly fun to fight and (except for 1 or 2) all felt fair to fight;
And oh my god, the final battle, is just incredible, the music and the battle itself feels so grand and emotional after going through all the journeys in dark souls 1, 2 and 3.

(I also feel like this is the best introductory point to the franchise, as the bosses are easy compared to some of the other entries I have finished (Bloodborne, Sekiro, Elden Ring, Dark Souls 1 are the ones I have played))

The level design is great, some people might prefer the metroidvania aspect of DS1, but to me, that was overshadowed by some of the areas being horrible to traverse and the bonfire spacing being pretty bad aswell.

The build variety is great as always, I tried a lot of stuff and played some pvp with different builds in this run, but ultimately the one I stuck to was a classic strength greatsword build.

And finally, the lore is fantastic as always, Dark Souls has one of the best worlds and stories I've ever seen and this was a great conclusion to the trilogy adding even more to the overarching story.

I still want to 100% the game and buy the DLC's, but even so I can confidently say that I loved this game, you should definitely play it when you have the chance.

185207601.review: A friend of mine introduced me to FromSoft games by gifting me Elden Ring. After completing that game, I went back and played Dark Souls 1 which was amazing! Then I played Dark Souls 2 which was also amazing! Here I am after beating Dark Souls 3... WOW! I am a little sad that I slept on these games when they originally released but I am glad I am enjoying them now. Dark Souls 3 was an amazing journey, and seeing some of the locations and characters from Dark Souls 1 return was exciting and nostalgic. Another amazing story filled with several really fun bosses, except you Nameless King, lol. (On average, I beat every boss in 1 to 3 tries, but Nameless King took me over a dozen. Jokes aside though, they were still awesome!) A bunch of the armor sets from the previous games also returned which was an awesome touch, and so did a lot of the weapons. With Dark Souls 3 now completed, I am happy to say that the Dark Souls series is in my top 10 favorite series of all time. For those interested in trying out any of the games, I strongly recommend giving them a try!

185206241.review:
Dark Souls 3 is an outstanding masterpiece that takes players on an unforgettable journey through a dark world. The atmosphere is undoubtedly one of the game’s strongest aspects. Every location, from the hauntingly beautiful ruins of Lothric Castle to the eerie depths of the Catacombs of Carthus, is dripping with detail and lore. The world feels alive yet desolate, pulling you deeper into its mystery with every step.

What truly sets Dark Souls 3 apart is its challenging yet rewarding gameplay. Every enemy encounter demands focus and strategy, and each boss fight is an unforgettable experience that tests your patience, skill, and determination. The sense of accomplishment after overcoming these challenges is unparalleled, making every victory feel truly earned.

Visually, the game is stunning. The intricate details of the environments, the terrifyingly beautiful boss designs, and the atmospheric lighting combine to create a world that feels both oppressive and awe-inspiring. Even years after its release, Dark Souls 3’s graphics hold up remarkably well, immersing players in its dark fantasy setting.

The items and weapons add another layer of depth to the game. From powerful swords and axes to unique spells and rings, every piece of loot feels meaningful. Experimenting with different builds and strategies ensures a fresh experience with every playthrough.

In summary, Dark Souls 3 is a triumph of atmosphere, challenge, and artistry. It’s a game that demands much from its players but rewards them with an experience they’ll never forget.

185185352.review:
This game took me years to understand how to get into. I initially struggled with what to do, especially in the high wall. Even still, I kept coming back to the game, trying to figure out what to do. After a while of playing the game on and off, restarting each time. Eventually, I decided to watch some challenge runs of the game, and used them to help me better understand the game and what to do. I started one last run, and was finally able to beat the first main boss, Vordt, and I kept going from there. I worked to understand the game, and through every wall that I hit, I was able to persist and figure out what I was doing wrong. 

My point is with this is that the game is hard when you are first figuring it out, but when you eventually can get the combat and such down, it becomes incredibly satisfying and rewarding to work through. It took me YEARS to get into the game, so if you can't get into this game when first trying to play through it, give it time, and try it again later.

Peguei todas as conquistas. Passei raiva, porém é recompensador, e já adianto, tenham tempo livre pois demora bastante. Repetindo RECOMENDO!!!!!!!!!!!!!

垃圾游戏 因为你根本就没法从震撼中回过神来好好玩

关于 战斗 大多数boss战的难度远远小于推图  部分战斗的设计真的可以称为艺术  当然也不乏充数的boss  个人感觉dlc不论是推图还是boss比本体要难
关于艺术制作  还是 真的震撼  无敌的配乐让你在游戏中完全沉浸 无敌的美术将这一幅传奇画卷完美呈献   当你在压抑黑暗的卡萨斯地下墓地已经受苦多时 走出洞口映入眼帘的就是美丽奇幻的冷冽谷的伊鲁席尔  相信每个第一次经过这里的小灰烬都会被震撼到  这里是我认为最瘦震撼的场景设计
关于剧情  经典碎片化叙事和谜语人设计   刚开始玩的时候可能会不知道要干啥  整体流程中等长度  npc支线剧情又较多且个别还有冲突  都会很容易错过或过不全剧情  走不同npc的剧情会有不同的结局

当你撕碎绘画枭雄的阴谋 拯救被束缚的冷冽灵魂 打破幽邃主教虚伪的信仰 将暴食的罪人斩首 
传承监视深渊的意志 粉碎沉入黑暗的暴君 伴随着友人最真挚的承诺 用风暴来击倒大树

误入即将褪色的画卷 将虚假的安宁烧毁 在混乱的时间潮流中 见证恶魔最后的绝唱

之后 你将会赞叹这一黑暗的史诗 感慨于这场传奇的悲剧

“是的，那是伊鲁席尔后院，是历代并非骑士的故乡，也是魂5汇流之地。小骑士皆向北而行，并了解下指的含义。环已渐取，然位不见奴隶头巾。当精力条耗尽之时，切宠爱戒指的声音响彻四周，唤醒眼球和符中等待的贵物们——暗脂圣者·小镰刀奴隶、房顶监视者·单蹲原力逼，以及后院的孤独王者·屋檐左弓b。可是，踹哈们一定会舍弃自己的小零食吧，而懵懂的小骑士们将纷至沓来，那是并非无言的，学不会取的，成不了踹哈的魂5，但也正因如此，魂5们才会如此渴求下指吧。

“火已渐熄 然位不见王影 钟声响彻之时 无火的余灰将纷沓而至
从北方不死院的天命不死人继承初火 到多兰古雷格的受诅咒者登上渴望王座 在这辉煌史诗映照下的灰烬 仿佛就如同他的名字一般 灰烬 
但是啊 纵使身份卑微 你也从不畏惧死亡 
你和古老的英雄一样 正见证着时代的变革……”

“灰烬大人 您还听得见我的声音吗”

185160275.review: I have played this game an unhealthy amount of times and every play-through, I feel like something is missing and I finally think I figured it out. This game has a lot of fast moving, highly agile enemies that attack in large mobs.  Imagine having a high-powered pistol in your off hand to quickly break the poise of your enemies when timed right, allowing you to then attack them stunned for large chunk of damage.   A very visceral attack in its nature because it damages the enemies in their internal organs.  The gun could use special bullets made from silver or mercury to give them a magical quality.  But instead of calling them mercury bullets, because that’s lame, we could name them quicksilver bullets because it sounds way cooler. Then, because you are one-handing your main weapon, you could have it switch on the fly to a larger weapon with a new move-set.  Think of a large dagger that flips out to a spear or scythe... or a big cleaver that flips out like a saw?   This would be a great way to add combos to your fighting style, switching between light and heavy attacks in the folded version of the weapon and then switching to an entirely new move-set when it coverts.  It may be kind of tricky at first to get used to, but I think it would make combat flow really nicely.  I know, you are asking, “But what about shields or armor?” Well we all know it’s all about the fashion in this game so you would have armor that is more about moving fast than tanking damage.  And shields, well shields are nice, but not if they engender passivity.   Oh!  And then you could have all kinds of few enemies that are not just your typical Knights and dragons to fight.  What about having cosmic horror monsters?  Tanking the best ideas from H.P. Lovecraft and Robert E. Howard’s Solomon Kane books and making a whole Nightmare world of new monsters!    I know some of you probably think this is just a silly idea, but I think this could be a great addition to this game.  And I bet if FromSoft made a game with these features would be a MONEY PRINTING MACHINE on ALL PLATFORMS and even game of the year or Greatest Hits down the road!  Maybe I’m crazy for thinking this.

185141425.review:
Один из лучших представителей соулслайков.В отличии от той же Elden Ring,которая безусловно также является одной из лучших игр не только своего жанра,но и в целом во всей игровой индустрии.Третий Dark Souls обладает более мрачной и нагнетающей атмосферой.Замки выполнены настолько великолепно,что ты не пропускаешь ни единого угла,чтобы залутать все,что только можно.По нескольку раз проходишь одни и те же локации,дабы окончательно убедиться в том,что ты не пропустил секретную тропу,ведущую к очередному босс файту.Останавливаешься время от времени,чтобы поглядеть на местные пейзажи.Радуешься новой мощной находке,в виде брони или оружия.Наслаждаешься и смакуешь каждую битву с боссом,коих здесь много,а после победы выдыхаешь с облегчением.
Безустанно продолжаю твердить,насколько хороша эта игра.Она относится именно к тем проектам,которые нужно щупать самому.Идеально подойдет для пробы новичкам,перед погружением в Elden.
10 Лотриков из 10.

185050139.review:
Dark Souls 3: A Masterpiece of Challenge and Atmosphere
Dark Souls 3 is a true gem in the gaming world, delivering a perfect blend of punishing difficulty, stunning world design, and deep lore. FromSoftware’s signature dark fantasy style reaches new heights in this entry, making it an unforgettable journey for fans of the series and newcomers alike.

Gameplay and Combat
The core of Dark Souls 3 is its tight, methodical combat. Every enemy encounter feels like a carefully choreographed dance where timing, strategy, and patience are key. The bosses are the crown jewels of the experience—intense, memorable, and beautifully designed. While challenging, each victory feels hard-earned and immensely rewarding, driving you to push forward despite the odds.

World and Exploration
The world of Dark Souls 3 is a hauntingly beautiful labyrinth. From the desolate ruins of Lothric Castle to the eerie swamps and fiery depths of Smouldering Lake, every area is dripping with atmosphere. The interconnected level design encourages exploration, rewarding curiosity with hidden treasures, shortcuts, and lore-rich details. It’s a world that feels alive, even in its decay.

Lore and Storytelling
As with all Souls games, the lore is deep and mysterious, woven into item descriptions, cryptic NPC dialogue, and environmental storytelling. Unraveling the story is a rewarding puzzle in itself, offering layers of depth to those who seek it. The melancholic tone and themes of despair, sacrifice, and rebirth add an emotional weight to the journey.

Replayability and Community
Dark Souls 3 offers incredible replay value, with multiple character builds, branching paths, and endings. Its online components—co-op, invasions, and messages—add an extra layer of unpredictability and fun. The community remains passionate, keeping the game alive with discussions, mods, and fan creations.

Verdict
Dark Souls 3 is a masterclass in game design, combining challenging gameplay, breathtaking environments, and rich storytelling into a seamless package. It’s a game that demands perseverance but rewards you with a sense of accomplishment few other games can match.

Rating: 10/10
A legendary action RPG that stands as one of the finest examples of FromSoftware’s brilliance. Prepare to die—and love every second of it

184870405.review:
What a journey.

I linked the Fire in Lordran, thinking it would solve anything.

I sought a different solution with Aldia in Drangleic, and whatever came of that, nobody knows.

I grew disillusioned by the linking of the First Flame, seeing the ruin it wrought Lothric and its merging lands. Old royalties perishing, legacies being made into nothing.

I gave my Fire Keeper eyes, seeing betrayal and putting an age that should've been long past put to rest. But before that, I followed the slave knight to the ends of the world. I gave the white-haired girl the immortal pigment of the Dark Soul, and putting the hope of the world in her painting.

In that final fight, everything came together. I felt like, in the final battle, Gwyn himself came back to stop me. Sensing betrayal of the fire, he shoved aside all the powerful Lords of Cinder so he could make himself manifest one last time. He realized that this was the one Ash that would put an end to his reign, and in horror he sprouted. To me, it felt like this was his desperate attempt to preserve his selfish Age of Flame that caused all the chaos. And even in his final moments, he would try to stop it. To keep the power from falling out of his grasp. No matter the end, his worst fears came to be. In the end, a world was made with the Dark Soul. One he could never hope to stop. One that would have no need for relinking. One that would last forever. Made in the very land of exile he created. One that would outlive him, and all who followed suit. 

I guess what I'm trying to say, is that this series really clicked. All three entries are necessary for maximum enjoyment of this magical journey. The 'freedom of interpretation' story made it deeply personal, and I wish I could experience it for the first time again.

So savour your adventure, and don't you dare go hollow.

184865161.review:
So, the third Souls game from FromSoft I've played, after Elden Ring & Dark Souls 1...

And? Well, it fel alot like revisiting Dark Souls 1, but everything's new and improved. There are merchants just like in DS1, but this time you can actually sell stuff to them, bonefires are placed more conveniently than in DS1, many bosses feels lke improved versions of past bosses in DS1 or in some cases prototypes of bosses we meet in Elden Ring - with some interesting switch-arounds; Gundyr, the first boss we encounter, is for example more like Margit than the Asylum demon, while Vordt is indeed more like the Asylum demon... But otherwise, many feels like encounters with new and improved versions of bosses, such as Midir of Kalamet or the Soul of Cinder of Gwyn - and perhaps Gael of Artorias, though we meet him last instead of first, making him yet another switch-around...

Anyway, it's what you'd expect from a Souls game - tough enemies both big and small, lots of deaths (many of those from some stupid mistake or another), rage/frustration over loss of souls, gorgeous views, intriguing lore, lots of attractive loot/treasure, interesting encounters with NPCs both hostile and not, plenty of exploration... All that's needed to keep the players interested as they stubbornly trudge along.

Now, while I've interacted more with the multiplayer part of the game here than in any other FromSoft Game thus far - and while I found it interesting enough, I'm still not entirely fond of how it works. I mean, if you want the stuff associated with the covenants, you pretty much HAVE to do multiplayer, since the only way to otherwise get the stuff you have to turn in to the covenants is by farming, but since they're very rare drops, it'll likely take longer to do than doing multiplayer... But doing multiplayer can turn out to be just as troublesome for a number of reasons. For one thing, if you're not very good at multiplayer, it'll be a while before you get the stuff you need. Secondly, there may be a lack of players and whatnot plus there's the level restrictions as well, so... 

To paint an image, I spent a lot of time playing as a sunbro but getting the covenant items took more time than I feel should be necessary not just because it's a rare drop, but also because, while I did offer my services in coop for bosses it sometimes took a long time before I was summoned for the fight in question, if I was summoned at all. This surely makes it all more troublesome, because in addition to the restictions on coop, a lot of people in these souls games take pride in being able to finish a boss by themselves, or with the aid of only NPC-summons, which are more in-game/in-story than a summoned player could ever be.

I must say I'm also unhappy about the absence of any achievements for the DLCs. At least give us achievements for Friede, Midir and Gael, goddamn it!

Speaking of the DLCs, I feel that in some ways, I can't really praise The Ringed City as much as I want to, in part because it's a little too, shall we say, gimmicky at times, meaning the existance of some enemies such as the constantly respawning skeletons at the Dreg Heap, the Angels and the Judicators with their summons and whatnot. In addition, the enemies along the path of the Ringed City are  strong, tough or have annoying abilities (thinking specifically of the Hollow Clerics for the last one; they can target the player from much further away than I feel should be the case, while also remaining far or altogether out of sight from the player, making progressing through the Ringed City a slow annoying slog at best, which I feel shouldn't be the case...

In summary: if you have already played some souls game or another, you should feel right at home in the game and if not, it's a good place to start your learning curve - if beating Gundyr doesn't strike you as too daunting a task, as such...

идеально, шедеврально, божественно, блаженствено.Одна из лучших соулс-игр, невероятно атмосферная, интересная и динамичная. Боссы — отдельная история, каждый из них уникален и запоминается надолго. Чего стоят только Хранители Бездны с их скоростью, силой и напряжённой динамикой боя.
Дизайн в стиле тёмного фэнтези и средневековья выполнен идеально: всё проработано до мелочей, а персонажи настолько живые, что создаётся ощущение, будто ты разговариваешь с ними в реальной жизни.
На первый взгляд игра может показаться сложной, особенно при первом прохождении, но со временем начинаешь понимать её механики. Как говорится, самая сложная соулс-игра — это твоя первая поэтому все заебок 
Лор всей трилогии Dark Souls — это произведение искусства. Он глубоко продуман, захватывающий и интересный тот самый лор, который не наскучит даже спустя недели изучения, как и сама игра.
Боевая система здесь — на высшем уровне: быстрая, динамичная и очень крутая. В отличие от Dark Souls 2, боссы намнго сильнее чем в дарк соулс 2 где они все деревянные.
В общем, это по-настоящему легендарная игра.
АХАХАХАХХАХАХА КАЗУАЛ ЕБАНЫЙ

Il migliore della serie, o comunque se la batte bene con DS1.

I comandi da tastiera sono tornati ad essere come quelli di DS1. Purtroppo come in DS2 i suggerimenti dei comandi sulla GUI restano quelli del controller anche se usi la tastiera. Davvero non capisco il perché di questa scelta, considerando che nel primo gioco c'erano.
Il sistema delle magie è cambiato, invece di avere un numero limitato di lanci per magia, ogni lancio consuma un certo tot di PA condivisi per tutte le magie/abilità, con la possibilità di ricaricare tramite estus apposita. Il classico mana insomma. Personalmente giocando con build mago l'ho apprezzato. Purtroppo le build da mago sono sempre un po' trascurate, ma è così in tutti souls. Come sempre sei abbastanza scarso per tutto il gioco finché non trovi le lance dell'anima verso la fine e diventi op. Pochi catalizzatori, poche vesti da mago, magie completamente inutili (dardo di farran, ecc), ecc.

Per il resto, riprende tutto quello che c'era di bello in DS1 e lo perfeziona. A livello di gamplay, di meccaniche e di design dei livelli, secondo me è il migliore della serie. Devo dire però che l'ambientazione del falò non è granché, preferisco di gran lunga Majula di DS2 o il santuario del legame del fuoco di DS1

184757886.review:
The third and final Dark Souls game to be released, Dark Souls 3 is by no means a perfect game. Yet, it's a lovely send-off for the series. Dark Souls 3 continues to show FromSoftware always looking to innovate upon their formula. One that continuously brings people, time-and-time again, back for another run. 

For one, the music and visuals. Well, music and soundscape is always quite good. There really isn't anything too jarring. The sounds give the perfect feedback. The music, which mostly plays in bosses, does it's best to add to the grandiose nature of the fight. But the visuals are definitely a peak here. I did have some minor graphical hiccups, but overall, the world just feels so fleshed out. I do find myself entranced with every new area I come across. How every little detail brings that much more out of the environment. And the environmental storytelling is just as good as always. For a game almost 10 years old, it's a marvel to look at still.

The story is what you would expect. There is a lot lore hidden about the world. But, if you aren't too interested in doing a deep dive or looking yourself, the main story beats are enough to get you a base understanding of things. Nothing spectacular, but nothing bad either.

The gameplay is what you have come to expect. After the backlash of Dark Souls 2, and the learned lessons from Bloodborne, you can see this game being shaped. A faster game in some regards, with more aggressive bosses. Some bosses have transformations halfway through their health bar, changing the fight completely. Yet the rolling has be tweaked to be more forgiving than Dark Souls 2. Estus is back as we all know it, and durability is no longer as egregious as Dark Souls 2. While a lot is the same, there are so many small changes and additions which make the game absolutely stunning. 

Dark Souls 3 is far from perfect. There are some areas where loading can certainly take some time, most notably in Firelink shrine. This is also, not so much in the main game, but you start seeing health bars increasingly drastically, fights becoming more a war of attrition. But this game is certainly magical to me. This has always been my favourite in the three Dark Souls games there are. I love all the flaws, all the tweaks and additions, and the bosses. While FromSoftware does continue to move forward, I will always come back to this game. Dark Souls 3 is a special package, and a great way to send off the series of Dark Souls.

184754490.review:
Dark Souls 3 is more than a game—it’s a trial by fire. From the haunting ruins of Lothric to the ashen plains of the Kiln of the First Flame, every step is steeped in melancholic beauty and relentless danger. The interconnected world design, filled with hidden paths and shortcuts, rewards curiosity and perseverance.

Combat is tight and punishing, where every Estus flask counts and even basic enemies can end your journey. Iconic bosses like Pontiff Sulyvahn and the Nameless King push your skills to their limit, creating unforgettable moments of triumph.

Lore enthusiasts will relish uncovering the ties to Gwyn, the linking of the fire, and the tragic fates of characters like Ludleth and Anri. The game’s cryptic storytelling invites deep dives into item descriptions and environmental clues.

Dark Souls 3 isn’t just a game—it’s a rite of passage for fans of dark fantasy. Prepare to die, learn, and rise again.

184701102.review:
Dark Souls III é uma obra prima que prende os jogadores com sua ambientação sombria, combate dificil para um caralho e bosses de cair o cu da bunda. A FromSoftware conseguiu criar um jogo que é ao mesmo tempo punitivo e recompensador, oferecendo uma experiência única que testa a habilidade e a paciência dos jogadores.

No entanto, para aqueles que buscam a platina, o jogo pode se tornar um verdadeiro teste de resistência. A necessidade de farmar certos itens como "proof of concord kept" pode e vai tornar jornada em uma tarefa tediosa e repetitiva. Embora o desafio seja parte do charme de Dark Souls III, o grind necessário para alcançar a platina pode afastar alguns jogadores.

Em resumo, Dark Souls III é um jogo excelente que vale a pena ser jogado, mas esteja preparado para dedicar muitas horas ao farm se você quiser conquistar todos os troféus.

Nota: 1000/10

184694765.review:
**Análise Detalhada de *DARK SOULS™ III***  

*DARK SOULS™ III* é a culminação de uma série icônica que redefiniu o gênero de RPGs de ação, oferecendo uma experiência desafiadora, emocionalmente envolvente e artisticamente impressionante. Como o ápice da franquia, o jogo combina os melhores elementos de seus antecessores com inovações que o tornam uma obra-prima incomparável.  

### **Jogabilidade**  
O sistema de combate de *DARK SOULS™ III* é refinado, fluido e incrivelmente satisfatório. Cada golpe, esquiva e bloqueio exige precisão e estratégia, recompensando a paciência e a habilidade do jogador. A variedade de armas, magias e estilos de jogo oferece liberdade para criar builds únicas, adaptando-se às preferências de cada jogador.  

### **Mundo e Exploração**  
O design do mundo interconectado é uma obra de arte. Lothric e suas áreas circundantes são vastas, detalhadas e cheias de segredos esperando para serem descobertos. Cada ambiente, desde catedrais sombrias até florestas assombradas, é meticulosamente construído para transmitir uma sensação de história e desolação.  

### **Desafios e Progressão**  
A dificuldade desafiadora, marca registrada da série, está presente em cada esquina. Enfrentar chefes gigantescos e inimigos impiedosos é uma mistura de tensão e triunfo. A progressão é recompensadora, com uma sensação constante de superação de obstáculos aparentemente insuperáveis.  

### **Narrativa e Atmosfera**  
A narrativa de *DARK SOULS™ III* é rica em simbolismo e contada principalmente através de descrições de itens, diálogos enigmáticos e detalhes ambientais. Esse estilo implícito convida o jogador a mergulhar profundamente no lore, criando uma conexão pessoal com o mundo e seus mistérios. A atmosfera é sombria e opressiva, amplificada pela trilha sonora épica e o design de som imersivo.  

### **Áudio e Visual**  
Graficamente, o jogo é deslumbrante, com cenários grandiosos e um uso magistral de luz e sombra. A trilha sonora, composta por Yuka Kitamura, é poderosa e emotiva, complementando perfeitamente os momentos de calmaria e os confrontos intensos.  

### **Conclusão**  
*DARK SOULS™ III* é mais do que um jogo; é uma experiência transformadora. Sua combinação de desafio, beleza e profundidade narrativa cria um legado inesquecível. É um título obrigatório para fãs da série e para aqueles que buscam uma jornada épica e desafiadora.  

Avaliação Final: ★★★★★ (5/5)  
Como um encerramento épico para uma das maiores séries de RPG de todos os tempos, *DARK SOULS™ III* é, sem dúvida, uma obra-prima que continuará a ser celebrada por gerações de jogadores.
